intro: Alyxia caletioides, commonly known as the white-flowered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Alyxia caletioides is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
